techniques.comment: The attackers use several commands such as "cmd.exe /C ipconfig /all", "cmd.exe /C ver", "cmd.exe /C wmic os get osarchitecture", among others, to gather information about the infected system.

The malware uses the command "cmd.exe /C WMIC /Node:localhost /Namespace:\root\SecurityCenter2 Path AntiVirusProduct Get displayName" to discover what antivirus software is installed on the infected system.
The attackers appear to utilize PowerShell command to download and execute the next stage payload from a remote host.

Lazarus uses initial access to vulnerable publicly-exposed servers combined with successful exploitation of CVE-2021-44228, also known as Log4Shell, to transfer its tools into the networking environment.
The attackers utilize commands designed to dump the credentials stored in the Windows Digest authentication package.
The adversaries created a new local user account and granted it administrative privileges.
The adversaries created a new local user account and granted it administrative privileges.
Actively using HazyLoad, a proxy tool, to maintain direct external access to infected system.
The attackers initially gain access by successfully exploiting CVE-2021-44228, also known as Log4Shell, on publicly facing VMWare Horizon servers.
The threat actors use a specific registry modification command to prepare for OS Credential Dumping.
